content:
I have a project with 8 lean files. When I try to import one of these files (reasons.lean) in a new lean file, I get an error message "object file './build/lib/lewis/lewis/reasons.olean' of module lewis.lewis.reasons does not exist". What can I do to ensure that these object files exist? I have attached a picture of the structure of my folder.
Foto-30-10-2023-om-08.35.jpg
A message was moved here from #new members > import fails by Huub Vromen.
Can you compile reasons.lean on the command line? What is the output of lake build Lewis.reasons on the command line, run in the root directory of the project repo?
After '''lake build Lewis.reasons"' there appear files in the build/lib/Lewis directory and then it is possible to import reasons.lean!
Do I have to do this for each file that I write, or can this be done automatically?
This should be done automatically, it's odd that it didn't happen for you
lake build does not do "build every lean file I can find in the repo", it only does "build every lean file on some list".
Huub Vromen has marked this topic as resolved.
